segment.source: Use a Configuration Set with Windows Setup
segment.target: Use a Configuration Set with Windows Setup

segment.source: Use a Configuration Set with Windows Setup
segment.target: Use a Configuration Set with Windows Setup

segment.source: Use a Configuration Set with Windows Setup
segment.target: Use a Configuration Set with Windows Setup

segment.source: Use a configuration set to add applications, drivers, packages, scripts, files and folders to Windows during installation.
segment.target: Use a configuration set to add applications, drivers, packages, scripts, files and folders to Windows during installation.

segment.source: A configuration set is a portable collection of files and folders that you can place on a USB Flash Drive (UFD) or on a network share.
segment.target: A configuration set is a portable collection of files and folders that you can place on a USB Flash Drive (UFD) or on a network share.

segment.source: To use a configuration set, you need the following:
segment.target: To use a configuration set, you need the following:

segment.source: A configuration set.
segment.target: A configuration set.

segment.source: For more information, see Create a Configuration Set.
segment.target: For more information, see Create a Configuration Set.

segment.source: A Windows product DVD.
segment.target: A Windows product DVD.

segment.source: A removable media, such as a USB flash drive (UFD), if you intend to install without a network.
segment.target: A removable media, such as a USB flash drive (UFD), if you intend to install without a network.

segment.source: A bootable Windows PE media if you intend to install from a network.
segment.target: A bootable Windows PE media if you intend to install from a network.

segment.source: For more information, see WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive.
segment.target: For more information, see WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive.

segment.source: How to use a Configuration Set with a Windows DVD
segment.target: How to use a Configuration Set with a Windows DVD

segment.source: Turn on the computer.
segment.target: Turn on the computer.

segment.source: Insert both the removable media that contains your configuration set and the Windows product DVD into the new computer.
segment.target: Insert both the removable media that contains your configuration set and the Windows product DVD into the new computer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When using a USB flash drive, insert the drive directly into the primary set of USB ports for the computer.
segment.target: When using a USB flash drive, insert the drive directly into the primary set of USB ports for the computer.

segment.source: For a desktop computer, this is typically in the back of the computer.
segment.target: For a desktop computer, this is typically in the back of the computer.

segment.source: Restart the computer by pressing CTRL+ALT+DEL.
segment.target: Restart the computer by pressing CTRL+ALT+DEL.

segment.source: When the computer reboots, you might be prompted to press any key to boot from the CD-ROM drive.
segment.target: When the computer reboots, you might be prompted to press any key to boot from the CD-ROM drive.

segment.source: Press any key and Windows Setup (Setup.exe) starts automatically.
segment.target: Press any key and Windows Setup (Setup.exe) starts automatically.

segment.source: By default, Windows Setup searches all removable media for an answer file that is named Autounattend.xml.
segment.target: By default, Windows Setup searches all removable media for an answer file that is named Autounattend.xml.

segment.source: Autounattend.xml must be located at the root of the removable media.
segment.target: Autounattend.xml must be located at the root of the removable media.

segment.source: Installation starts, and the settings you configured in your answer file will be applied.
segment.target: Installation starts, and the settings you configured in your answer file will be applied.

segment.source: How to use a Configuration Set from a Network
segment.target: How to use a Configuration Set from a Network

segment.source: Create two folders on a network share to store the product DVD source files and your configuration set.
segment.target: Create two folders on a network share to store the product DVD source files and your configuration set.

segment.source: For example,
segment.target: For example,

segment.source: Copy the content of the product DVD to the WindowsDVD folder.
segment.target: Copy the content of the product DVD to the WindowsDVD folder.

segment.source: Copy your configuration set to the ConfigurationSets folder.
segment.target: Copy your configuration set to the ConfigurationSets folder.

segment.source: Boot the destination computer by using a bootable Windows PE media.
segment.target: Boot the destination computer by using a bootable Windows PE media.

segment.source: For information about creating bootable Windows PE media, see WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive.
segment.target: For information about creating bootable Windows PE media, see WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive.

segment.source: At a command prompt in Windows PE, map a network drive to your network share.
segment.target: At a command prompt in Windows PE, map a network drive to your network share.

segment.source: For example,
segment.target: For example,

segment.source: Run Windows Setup from the network and reference your answer file in your configuration set.
segment.target: Run Windows Setup from the network and reference your answer file in your configuration set.

segment.source: For example,
segment.target: For example,
